reviewText: I saw another documentary (forget the name) about the Gerson method for treating (curing) cancer and it intrigued me. This one filled in some gaps and really drove the whole thing home for me.Here's the scoop. Documentary film maker Steve Kroschel leaves Alaska for the lower 48 to examine the claims of the late Dr. Gerson and his curing cancer (and some other diseases) using nutrition instead of pharmaceuticals. He interviews former cancer patients, nutritionists, doctors and the like and comes up with some surprising information.This is tackled on several fronts. First, Kroschel does a brief history on Gerson himself. Who he was. Where he came from. His curing of Albert Schweitzer's diabetes and so on. He then talks to patients to get testimonies on what their particular illness was and where they are today. He also speaks with doctors and nutritionists and this is where things get dicey. Most of the professionals interviewed dismiss Gerson out of hand even when they haven't read the findings or interviewed those who have been cured. And the reasons between them are surprisingly similar. 'They were mis-diagnosed and never had cancer to begin with.' 'Gerson was a quack.' 'The clinics take your money and send you away.' They begin to look rather silly after awhile. Part of it seems to be that the Gerson method can't be studied by the standard method of a double blind test used in the medical arena. Then there are the accusations that the cancer treatment industry is so large, the powers that be don't want to cure it at all. There's too much money in treating it. Particularly when the patients can cure themselves, once they know what to do, and wouldn't need drugs or radiation treatments.We've heard this story in other areas, where some something could be righted but the powers in place simply won't let that happen. I find it criminal that, with a better than 50% success rate, a U.S. cancer patient must go to Mexico or Hungary to get this treatment. His own country won't support him. I find it interesting that when Dr. Gerson was ready to publish his work, he fell ill and, upon his recovery, found his manuscript missing. He fired his secretary when he found she was stealing records from him. He re-assembles the manuscript only to fall ill again. This time he tests himself and finds he's been poisoned by arsenic. Seems even back then those in power knew his method would number their days.See this and pass it on to anyone you love that could benefit from it.
summary: When Can We Take Our Lives Back

reviewText: I purchased this one, because Amazon recommended it. Again, great movie, little spin off of "Cancer. teh Forbidden Cures", but the interviews are more in depths and it is obvious, that certain M.D.'s are in bed with AMA and FDA, to control the chemotherapy industry and Big Pharma villains. Very depressing, sad....I believe every single human being has the right to make his/her own decision, but it should be based on educational decision, not some money driven indoctrination!
summary: Another great anti cancer conventional treatment documentary

reviewText: Steve Jobs would probably be alive today if he had not wasted many months on "alternative medicine" after being diagnosed with neuroendocrine cancer of the pancreas. He understood his mistake too late to save his own life but in time to warn friends to proceed directly to "western medicine" when faced with a cancer diagnosis. Heed his advice.Enemas of coffee or castor oil will not stop the spread of a malignancy any more than fruit juice will. Gerson "therapy" is based upon ideas that amount to quackery and that are not based in science or even upon an understanding of human physiology. A casual search on the internet will clarify this point.This film is a pile of manure. Don't waste your time watching it and please, no matter what, do not waste your money and your life on "Gerson therapy".
summary: Dangerous Lies About a Fraudulent and Unscientific Practice

reviewText: This thoughtful and inspiring documentary follows the 2 month quest of an investigatorinto the simple question - Why are cancer and other healing therapies SUPPRESSED bythe USA medical industry, and the laws of our land?The filmmakers do a respectful job even in the face of this reprehensiblesubject (a medical and food system that actually poisons instead of heals!!)and the sometimes vile characters who work behind the scenes to detract fromtruth and well being in the name of greedy profit.There is a journey and a story here, with some twists and turns, so I won't bea spoiler- this film, which takes the creators all over our country, and overseasto other countries, and to Japan-  will deliver a powerful, well researched messageas it unfolds before your eyes.  I invite you to raise your consciousnessin the name of the health and well being of yourself, friends, and family.
summary: Beautifully put together, An Eye Opener!

reviewText: The Gerson Therapy represents the courage and unselfishness of one man, Dr. Max Gerson, to help the world with their fight against all disease. The fact that this information has been suppressed, plagurized and kept from the general public by our medical community and its associations is absolutely criminal and if our government wasn't so corrupt, it would be corrected as it should've been when Dr. Gerson presented it to our Senate many, many years ago.Japan is using it and so is Europe to cure cancer and many other diseases and yet most of the people in America are still having chemotherapy presented to them as though it's the only way to cure cancer.
summary: Dying to have known DVD (Gerson Therapy)
